content.description: The   extension of “Dry Hump”. Once the lip has been reached, proceed right along   sloppy crimps and shallow 2-finger pockets on the face till the far-right lip   is reached then top-out into borderline nothing. Extra spotters/friends   recommended.
content.location: Start low on the central crack and proceed left, then right.

content.description: The   left-most line on the slasher boulder, start on the center hand-hold, then   blast left and straight up. Good feet and a slaby finish will follow. Great   route if your head game is on point.
content.location: Start   low on the central crack and proceed left and straight up.

content.description: Start as for Dry Hump. Do the crux of Malicious Smash Mouth - left hand to the crimp just under the lip and right hand to the leftmost slotted crimp. Instead of using the lip to finish straight up, traverse right along the slotted crimps of the steep face (without using the lip at all) until you reach the big jug at head height on the right arete. Grab a little crimp around the corner, paste your foot on a bad foothold, and do a big move to a crack. Finish up the tall face. Edit: Felt about as hard as Sweet Nothings. Maybe more like solid 11? Not entirely sure.
content.protection: 3 crashpads is enough that you won't need to move any.
content.location: Starts on the big ledge on the left side of the overhang, exits the right of the overhang to finish on the tall face.

content.description: Stand start of Malicious Smash Mouth
content.location: Start to the right of the sit start, on the lower two slots at about head-level.

content.description: Secluded bouldering area with high quality granite problems.
